text: Now in the following slides, I'm going to show you a few examples of where I would use
composite volume profiles.
The first example you can see in front of you is what I like to call a fundamental
composite profile.
What is this?
Well in basic sense, it's when we have a new fundamental in the market, whether
it's a change in supply and demand in the oil market, or whether it's a shift
What I like to do is when I see these, you know, trending type fundamental news
enter the market, I like to draw a composite profile.
Now as you can see on the left of this chart, well on the right of this chart we've
obviously got all the candlesticks
but on the left we've drawn a composite profile.
Now all that composite profile shows us is how volume is dispersed
over this entire move from the lows
Now, as you can see, when the new fundamental news hits the market, we can see very little
volume being traded in the lower end of this distribution of volume, or in this volume
profile.
Whereas, once the market finally runs into some responsive type selling, we tend to
see value being accepted, or the market developing fair price.
Now, it's very important and you can see why it's so powerful to use these compster profiles
because we can very quickly pick up where the market has rejected or where the market feels
was a discount price and then where the market feels is.
fair value price. Now, where I would tend to use this quite a lot, or how I would develop
trade strategy based on this, is so long as that fundamental news holds in the market,
I'd be looking to keep buying the low end prices ahead of that low volume area or
that area of prices that very little volume was traded over. Let's take a look now
at another example.
